wwutil.jsoda
Class Query<T>

java.lang.Object
  wwutil.jsoda.Query<T>

public class Query<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Query object to capture common query properties for both SimpleDB and DynamoDB

count

public long count()
           throws JsodaException
Execute the query to return the count, not the items.

Throws:
JsodaException

run

public java.util.List<T> run()
                      throws JsodaException
Execute the query and start returning result items. It might or might not return the entire result set. Call run() again to get the next batch of items. It will return an empty list when there's no more result. A typical loop to handle successive result batch. See another style of simpler iteration in hasNext()'s doc. 
  List items;
  while ((items = query.run()).size() != 0) {
      for (T item : items)
          dump(item);
  }

Throws:
JsodaException

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Quick check to see if there are more result to return. Before run() is called, hasNext() always returns true. This simplies the iteration loop. The typical loop is: 
  while (query.hasNext()) {
      for (Model1 item : query.run()) {
      }
  }

reset

public Query<T> reset()
Reset the result set if there's any. Restart the query if run() is called again.
